choices.answer: Your brain grows as you get older.
You're born with all the intelligence you will ever have.
With effort, you can train your brain to get smarter.
Growing your thinking means being open to learning new things.

questions.question: The human brain stays the same size for most of your life.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: How can you grow your brain?

choices.answer: Lifting really heavy weights.
Challenging your mind to learn.
Doing the things you're good at.
Using as little effort as possible to train your brain.

questions.question: Repeating things while you learn something helps you get better at it.

choices.answer: True
False
The ability of the brain to change as it learns new things.
The ability of your brain to create plastic.
The ability of your brain to create a unique idea.

questions.question: Habits are our established way of thinking and doing things.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: How do you develop a new habit or a new way of doing things?

choices.answer: Doing it over and over again (practice).
Thinking about it a lot.
Trying a lot of different new things.
True
False
